DataElement.preferredName: Ischemia And/Or Cardiomyopathy Etiology Disease or Disorder Involvement Suspected Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response regarding whether a blood deficiency in an organ or tissue caused by a constriction or obstruction of its blood vessels OR a cause of a disease of the heart muscle are possible diagnoses.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ischemia And/Or Cardiomyopathy Etiology Disease or Disorder Involvement Suspected
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood deficiency in an organ or tissue caused by a constriction or obstruction of its blood vessels._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A disease of the heart muscle or myocardium proper. Cardiomyopathies may be classified as either primary or secondary, on the basis of etiology, or on the pathophysiology of the lesion: hypertrophic, dilated, or restrictive._The cause of a disease._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._Believed likely.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Ischemia And/Or Cardiomyopathy Etiology Disease or Disorder Involvement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood deficiency in an organ or tissue caused by a constriction or obstruction of its blood vessels.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:A disease of the heart muscle or myocardium proper. Cardiomyopathies may be classified as either primary or secondary, on the basis of etiology, or on the pathophysiology of the lesion: hypertrophic, dilated, or restrictive.:The cause of a disease.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Lack of blood supply to an area of the body, resulting in impairment of tissue oxygenation.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

A disease of the heart muscle or myocardium proper. Cardiomyopathies may be classified as either primary or secondary, on the basis of etiology, or on the pathophysiology of the lesion: hypertrophic, dilated, or restrictive.
The cause of a disease or abnormal condition.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
